ChatGPT Voice to text

May 8, 2025

I don‚Äôt like the new OpenAI voice-to-text input.

The earlier version had a more thoughtful flow:

  • Active listening indicator: You saw a timer and microphone animation, which gave feedback that it was capturing your voice.
  • Transcription preview: After you spoke, the transcription was visible before sending. You could edit any mistakes.
  • Explicit submit step: You were in control of when the message was finalised and sent.

Now:

  • There‚Äôs no clear indication of how long you‚Äôve been speaking. It just says listening, then the state changes to transcribing, and then it just blasts off the query.
  • It auto sends the transcript without confirmation. And once the response comes you realise it could not understand your accent and wrongly transcribed like 5 critical words that changes the entire context of the query.
  • If the model mishears you, you can‚Äôt correct it unless you manually redo the entire message. Or correct after ChatGPT responds to your first message with typos.
  • And God forbid it throws errors like ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt catch that‚Äù, especially during longer recordings, there‚Äôs no option to retry, and you‚Äôll have to repeat everything you just said.

This ‚Äúfaster but dumber‚Äù flow works if everything goes perfectly, but when it doesn‚Äôt, it‚Äôs frustrating. Claude does something similar. No intermediate correction step, does not let you correct the transcription. Thankfully it still shows the timer.

Some PM at OpenAI probably optimised for speed and simplicity (1 tap voice interface), without realising voice messages are different from voice to text query sent to an LLM. The new UX assumes high transcription accuracy and fast LLM turnaround, which isn‚Äôt always true, especially with accents, ambient noise, and longer thoughts.
